four_wheeler_companies.name: Maruti Suzuki India Limited
four_wheeler_companies.description: As the largest automobile manufacturer in India, Maruti Suzuki specializes in small cars and holds a leading market share. Established in 1981, it has been instrumental in shaping India's automotive industry.

four_wheeler_companies.name: Hyundai Motor India Limited
four_wheeler_companies.description: A subsidiary of the South Korean automaker, Hyundai has a strong presence in the Indian market, offering a variety of models that cater to different consumer preferences.

four_wheeler_companies.name: Tata Motors Limited
four_wheeler_companies.description: A part of the Tata Group, Tata Motors offers a diverse range of vehicles, including electric cars. The company is investing in local EV battery production to maintain its market position.

four_wheeler_companies.name: Mahindra & Mahindra Limited
four_wheeler_companies.description: Known for its SUVs and electric vehicles, Mahindra & Mahindra has been a significant player in India's automotive sector. The company is focusing on expanding its electric vehicle lineup to meet growing demand.

four_wheeler_companies.name: Honda Cars India Limited
four_wheeler_companies.description: A subsidiary of the Japanese automaker, Honda offers a range of vehicles in India, known for their reliability and fuel efficiency.
